newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan leading indicator to top 50 mark in Sept - EPA.
newsitem.headline: Japan leading indicator to top 50 mark in Sept - EPA.

text.p: Japan's diffusion index of leading economic indicators is likely to rise above the so-called "boom or bust" mark of 50 in September after falling below that critical mark in August for the first time in five months, a senior official for the Economic Planning Agency (EPA) said on Tuesday.
The official said the index of coincident indicators was also expected to rise above the 50 mark in September.
The EPA had announced previously that the index of leading economic indicators stood at 33.3 on a scale of 100 in August, while that of coincident indicators was 30.0.

"The falls below the 50 mark in August were temporary, and the indices are likely to regain a level of above 50 in September," the official said. A temporary cut in output of cars and personal computers and production adjustment in semiconductors pushed down production-related indices which are components of the leading indicators, he added.
